detailsOfAchievement: Mobile Health Clinic This programme is under Directorate of Health Services Govt of NCT of Delhi Krishna Foundation is providing Mobile Health Services to community in urbanised slum areas of East Delhi particularly Krishna Nagar Mandawali Constituencies and to Gender Resource Centre GRC in Bhikam Singh Colony Vishwas Nagar Constituency We provide these services two days a week and for two hours per day in particular area. Apart from distribution of medicine, our team of health personnel provide advice about the general health awareness of different diseases like Gastroenteritis Hepatitis STD AIDS HIV infection and other common ailments in community We also provide vaccination to children in the community in particular week of month. We also provide medical help on special occasions like Kabar Camp or Haj Camp Prevention of AIDS HIV infection in IDUs Under NACO NACP III Krishna Foundation has been working in area of East Delhi for prevention of AIDS HIV infections in High Risk Group IDUs in partnership with Delhi State Aids Control Society DSACS under Directorate of Health, Govt. of NCT of Delhi Pulse Polio Immunisation Programme Krishna Foundation is actively involved in this programme under Directorate of Health Services Govt of NCT of Delhi. This programme has been conducted at A53 Kanti Nagar Main Near Krishna Nagar Delhi 110051 We conducted this programme as per guidelines of Govt of NCT Delhi. Apart from providing immunsation to children we also provide health education to their parents and family members to about the mode of spread of disease and relevant precaution. Merchants of Madness (MM) is a way to express, share and co-exist with ‘madness’ through art and performance. MM is built on a script, first published in an academic journal by Reshma Valliappan (founder of TRD) that examines psychosis, schizophrenia and the underlying consciousness of the voices in the head. MM has grown from that to a vision that will, through a public Festival of Madness, spark a discourse to challenge how we understand and relate to mental illness.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The micro project, Kross Kut Film Foundation provides warm blankets to poor people who live on footpath in shivery cold which get these destitute poor people. We have been giving our valuable support through Donation and we are thankful to you from the core of our heart. They shiver due to cold breeze all the night and some old age persons die of these waves.
KROSS KUT FILM FOUNDATION PROVIDES FREE OF COST COMPUTER COURSES &amp; FILM COURSES. FACILITY OF ALL LOW INCOME FAMILY MEMBERS AND POOR FAMILY MEMBERS IN FIELD OF FILM &amp; COMPUTER ETC.
KROSS KUT FILM FOUNDATION PROVIDES FREE OF COST COMPUTER COURSES &amp; FILM COURSES. FACILITY OF ALL LOW INCOME FAMILY MEMBERS AND POOR FAMILY MEMBERS IN FIELD OF FILM &amp; COMPUTER ETC.

People usually say that thousands of people die of cold, but we say that they die due to lack of woollen clothes and blankets. Poor and helpless people sleep in rags at footpath and roadside and die of cold. These poor people sleep close to each other during cold waves but how one can sleep sound without blanket or quilt in such conditions.
KROSS KUT FILM FOUNDATION, with the financial support of donation, distributed woollen blankets to these poor people so that they may be able to protect themselves from cold in winter nights.

Besides, there is severe lack of base-line data needed to plan proper preventive and interventional strategies in India

detailsOfAchievement: A) Our Society Maatritva Foundation and our Respected Founder Vice President has experienced working with the Safire International Pvt. Ltd. Regular Training Partner of National Digital Literacy Mission (NDLM) under Department of Electronics and Information Technology, Ministry of communication & Information Technology , Govt. of India. AND Foundation for Infrastructure and National Development Society (FINDS), Project Implement Agency for NDLM appoint by Safire of which is as follows. 1. Establishing Centers in 05 different Govt. Sr. Sec. Schools of Chandigarh (U.T) Administration under National Digital Literacy Mission to provide basic ICT skill to students from 01-01-2016 to31-05-2016. 2. Along with establishing centers in 12 other different Govt. Sr. Sec. Schools in Chandigarh (U.T) to provide the same basic ICT skill to Anganwadi workers/employees of Social Welfare Department Chandigarh (U.T) Administration covering the all Anganwadi area of entire Chandigarh from 02-06-2016 to 15-09-2016. 3. Presently our project implement agency/regular training partner of NDLM have also received an order copy Dated:23-09-2016 from Department of Post, India, Chandigarh Division, Chandigarh for the Same project (NDLM) to be conducted from dated: 15/10/2016 in 08 different Govt. Sr. Sec. Schools of Chandigarh (UT) Administration to provide basic ICT skills (NDLM) to the Postal employees. Our Maatritva foundation (Regd.) has completely cooperated in this entire project of NDLM and has helped to the Regular Training Partner and Project Implement Agency free of cost. Will do the same in the near future as well.
